The Chapter with Subhūti
The Elder’s Story of Taking the Five Precepts
“In the city of Candavatī,
I was a servant at that time;
Engaged in working for others,
I did not receive the going forth.
Covered by great darkness,
I was burning with the three fires;
By what means,
would I be free from bondage?
I had nothing to give as a gift,
I was a poor servant;
What if I were to guard
and fulfill the five precepts?
The sage Anomadassī,

translated: had a disciple named Nisabha;🔽Approaching him,
I took up the five training rules.
For a thousand years,

analyzed: āyu vijjati tāvade  tāvatā pañca sīlāni
translated: my lifespan lasted;🔽For that long I guarded
the fulfilled five precepts.
And when the time of death arrived,
the gods encouraged me:
‘A chariot yoked with a thousand horses,
is ready for you, dear sir.’
In my last thought,
I remembered my virtue;
By that well-done deed,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

analyzed: tisakkhattum ca devindo  deva rajjam akārayi
translated: Thirty times I was Sakka,🔽and a hundred times a king of gods.
I experienced divine happiness,
honoured with showers of flowers.

analyzed: pañca sattati khattum ca  cakkavattī ahosaha
translated: Seventy-five times I was a king,🔽a universal monarch,
a great king with extensive dominion,
incalculable by number.
Having fallen from the world of the gods,
urged on by the root of merit,
I was reborn in Vesālī,
in the great wealthy Sakyan family.
In the time of the rains,
when the Jina’s Dispensation was shining,

analyzed: mātā ca me pitā ca iva
translated: my mother and father
received the five precepts.
Having heard the precepts,
I remembered my own precepts.
While sitting on one seat,
I attained Liberation.
At the age of five years,🔽I attained Liberation.
The Buddha, the Visionary One,
knowing my virtue, gave me Acceptance.
Having fulfilled the five precepts,
for an immeasurable length of time,
I did not go to a lower realm.
I experienced fame,
through the power of those precepts.
Even if I were to speak for a koṭi of years,
I could not tell it all.
Having guarded the five precepts,
I obtained three things:
Long life, great wealth,
and I became one of keen wisdom.
I was a gatherer of all,
and a leader of men;
Wandering through the round of rebirths,
I obtained these things.🔽The disciples of the Conqueror,
practicing the immeasurable precepts,
If they were to be attached to rebirths,
what would be the result?
I, a disciple of the Buddha,
having well practiced the five precepts,
By that precept today
I have been released from all bonds.
For immeasurable eons in the past,
I guarded the five precepts;
I do not recall any bad destination—
this is the fruit of the five precepts.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations,
The six supernormal knowledges have been realized—
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus has it been heard by the Elder Pañcasīlasamādāniya.
